metadata.description: Not used, but needed to pass arm-ttk test `Location-Should-Not-Be-Hardcoded`.  We instead use the `workspace-location` which is derived from the LA workspace
[concat('Region to deploy solution resources -- separate from location selection',parameters('location'))]
Workspace name for Log Analytics where Microsoft Sentinel is setup
Name of the custom connector, if you want to change the default name, make sure to use the same in all OpenCTI automation playbooks as well
Enter your OpenCTI url for example: demo.opencti.io. Do NOT prefix with https:// or http:// etc

uiDefinition.tooltip: Provide your API Key starts with Bearer <<Key Value>>

properties.description: [[concat('This connector helps to authenticate with ', parameters('CustomConnectorName'), ' and running GraphQL queries')]

info.title: OpenCTICustomConnector
info.description: This connector helps to authenticate with OpenCTI and running GraphQL queries

post.description: This helps to run GraphQL queries on OpenCTI and returns response in JSON format. You can run any kind of query that supported by OpenCTI

metadata.title: Send to Security Graph API - Batch Import (OpenCTI)
metadata.description: This playbook sends messages to Security GraphAPI in batches
postDeployment: 1. Once deployment is complete, you will need to add ThreatIndicators.ReadWrite.OwnedBy permissions for system identity on Microsoft Security Graph.

2. Follow instructions that are described here (Post deployment steps) - https://github.com/Azure/Azure-Sentinel/blob/master/Solutions/OpenCTI/Playbooks/OpenCTIPlaybooks/OpenCTI-ImportToSentinel/readme.md#post-deployment-instructions

metadata.description: Name of the custom connector, if you want to change the default name, make sure to use the same in all OpenCTI automation playbooks as well
Name of the custom connector, if you want to change the default name, make sure to use the same in all OpenCTI automation playbooks as well
If you already have Organization in OpenCTI created, you can provide the same name. This is used while adding indicator to OpenCTI, used to identify who contributed the indicator.
This is used to easily identify the indicators that are added to OpenCTI. This label is assigned to all the indicators that are created using Playbook
Marking used while creating indicators in OpenCTI. If you already have marking, you can provide the same

<u>Account: @{items('For_each_Account_in_Entity')?['Name']} </u>

We have created new indicator with ID: @{body('Parse_JSON_Newly_created_Indicator_-_account')?['data']?['indicatorAdd']?['id']}

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_IP.inputs: IP Address: @{items('For_each_IP_in_Entity')?['Address']} No match found from OpenCTI We have created new indicator with ID @{body('Parse_JSON_Newly_created_Indicator_-_IP')?['data']?['indicatorAdd']?['id']} ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_UR.inputs: URL: @{items('For_each_URL_in_Entity')?['Url']} No match found from OpenCTI We have created new indicator with ID @{body('Parse_JSON_Newly_created_Indicator_-_URL')?['data']?['indicatorAdd']?['id']} ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Terminate_in_case_of_JSON_Parse_Failed.description: This step is to FAIL the workflow and stop in case of any Auth failures or issues while querying

metadata.title: Create Indicator - OpenCTI
metadata.description: This playbook adds new indicator in OpenCTI based on the entities info present in Sentinel incident. This playbook search in OpenCTI for indicatoes based on the entities (Account, Host, IP, FileHash, URL) present in Microsoft Sentinel incident. If it presnts in OpenCTI, information will be added to incident comment otherwise it creates new indicator in OpenCTI
prerequisites: 1. OpenCTI Custom Connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription.
2. API key. To get API Key, login into your OpenCTI instance dashboard and navigate to User profile page --> API Access.
postDeployment: 1. Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection.
2. Navigate to playbook --> API Connections --> Select connections one by one --> Edit API Connection --> (if required) Enter API key or credentials --> Save

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_Fi.inputs: File Hash: @{items('For_each_FileHash_in_Entity')?['Value']} No match found from OpenCTI ----------------------------------------------------------------------

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_Ho.inputs: Host Name: @{items('For_each_Host_in_Entity')?['HostName']} No match found from OpenCTI ----------------------------------------------------------------------

Compose_comment_message-_No_results_-_IP.inputs: IP Address: @{items('For_each_IP_in_Entity')?['Address']} No match found from OpenCTI ----------------------------------------------------------------------

Terminate_in_case_of_JSON_Parse_Failed.description: This step is to FAIL the workflow and stop in case of any Auth failures or issues while querying

metadata.title: Entity (IP, URL, FileHash, Account, Host) Enrichment - OpenCTI
metadata.description: This playbook search in OpenCTI for indicatoes based on the entities (Account, Host, IP, FileHash, URL) present in Microsoft Sentinel incident. If it presnts in OpenCTI, information will be added to incident comment.
prerequisites: 1. OpenCTI Custom Connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription.
2. API key. To get API Key, login into your OpenCTI instance dashboard and navigate to User profile page --> API Access.
postDeployment: 1. Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection.
2. Navigate to playbook --> API Connections --> Select connections one by one --> Edit API Connection --> (if required) Enter API key or credentials --> Save

metadata.description: Name of the custom connector, if you want to change the default name, make sure to use the same in all OpenCTI automation playbooks as well
TenantId of your azure instace. We use this while sending data to Security Graph API

metadata.title: Read Stream- OpenCTI Indicators
metadata.description: This playbook fetches indicators from OpenCTI and send to Sentinel. Supported types are Domain, File, IPv4, IPv6, Account, Url.  This runs for every 10 minutes
prerequisites: 1. OpenCTI Custom Connector needs to be deployed prior to the deployment of this playbook under the same subscription.
2. API key. To get API Key, login into your OpenCTI instance dashboard and navigate to User profile page --> API Access.
3. OpenCTI-ImportToSentinel must be installed and keep playbook name and batchname handy
postDeployment: 1. Once deployment is complete, you will need to authorize each connection.
2. Navigate to playbook --> API Connections --> Select connections one by one --> Edit API Connection --> (if required) Enter API key or credentials --> Save
